name: Prospective Commercial CCHP (FS)

market_entry_year_source.notes: Program target year for the technology performance level indicated by this ECM

source_data.title: Building Technologies Office Multi-Year Program Plan

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Convert primary COP of 1.07 (Table 3) to 3.61, multiply by 3.01 site-source conversion factor; COP = BTU out/BTU in

source_data.title: Building Technologies Office Multi-Year Program Plan

installed_cost_source.notes: $25/kBtu/h + baseline cost of $141.66/kBtu/h ($5100/36 kBtu/h); incremental installed cost from Table 3 of BTO MYPP, baseline cost from 2020 typical residential air source heat pump total installed cost

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Building Technologies Office Multi-Year Program Plan

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average lifetime for residential air source heat pumps for the 'typical' 2020 column

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.heating: Applies to all commercial buildings with natural gas-fueled heating; commercial buildings with electric heating are excluded

cooling.title: CBECS 2012 - Table B30 -  Cooling energy sources, number of buildings and floorspace
cooling.fraction_derivation: Cooling multiple of 55.7% was determined as a proportion of commercial building square footage where heating is done using natural gas from CBECS 2012 microdata. Total commercial square footage with electric cooling in the sample was 73614 million ft^2; of those buildings, natural gas heating is used in 40980 million ft^2.

_description: Air source heat pump target for application in colder climates and smaller commercial buildings (baselines might be derived from units for residential building); no fuel switching
